dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so we always hear about how bad sitting is for us, right? But I just read this article that, uh, puts a really interesting spin on it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so we always hear about how bad sitting is for us, right? But I just read this article that, uh, puts a really interesting spin on it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah? Like, I'm always looking for a silver lining to my couch potato habits. What's the good news?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah? Like, I'm always looking for a silver lining to my couch potato habits. What's the good news?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's not exactly good news for *sitting*, but it *is* good news for fighting obesity. Researchers at the University of Gothenburg, Sweden, think they've found the body's *second* system for regulating weight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's not exactly good news for sitting, but it is good news for fighting obesity. Researchers at the University of Gothenburg, Sweden, think they've found the body's second system for regulating weight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Researchers at Sweden's University of Gothenburg believe they may have discovered the body's second known system for regulating body weight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, second system? I thought it was all about, like, hormones and metabolism. What is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, second system? I thought it was all about, like, hormones and metabolism. What is it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They're calling them "internal bathroom scales." Apparently, our body weight is registered in our lower extremities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're calling them internal bathroom scales. Apparently, our body weight is registered in our lower extremities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Quite simply, we have found support for the existence of internal bathroom scales, explains Professor John-Olov Jansson, in a statement. The weight of the body is registered in the lower extremities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, our *legs* know how much we weigh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, our legs know how much we weigh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, pretty much! If your body weight starts to creep up, a signal gets sent to the brain to, uh, decrease food intake and keep things constant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, pretty much! If your body weight starts to creep up, a signal gets sent to the brain to, uh, decrease food intake and keep things constant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the body weight tends to increase, a signal is sent to the brain to decrease food intake and keep the body weight constant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's... wild. So our bodies have this innate way to, like, self-correct? How did they even figure that out?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's... wild. So our bodies have this innate way to, like, self-correct? How did they even figure that out?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They did this study with mice. They implanted capsules with extra weight into some mice, and a control group got empty ones. And after a few weeks, the mice with the added weight had actually shed white body fat to compensate!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did this study with mice. They implanted capsules with extra weight into some mice, and a control group got empty ones. And after a few weeks, the mice with the added weight had actually shed white body fat to compensate!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The study was conducted by implanting weights into the bellies of mice. Some rodents had capsules with weight equivalent to about 15 percent of their body mass implanted while a control group had empty capsules implanted. After a few weeks, the two groups had nearly the same weight, with the mice implanted with added weight apparently making up the difference by shedding white body fat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No way! So the mice basically, uh, just lost weight because their "scales" felt heavier? That's incredible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No way! So the mice basically, uh, just lost weight because their scales felt heavier? That's incredible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And what's really cool is this mechanism works *independently* of leptin, which is that hormone scientists discovered decades ago that regulates fat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And what's really cool is this mechanism works independently of leptin, which is that hormone scientists discovered decades ago that regulates fat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The mechanism that we have now identified regulates body fat mass independently of leptin, and it is possible that leptin combined with activation of the internal body scales can become an effective treatment for obesity, said Professor Claes Ohlsson at Gothenburg University.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so if it's separate from leptin, does that mean they could combine treatments? Like, that could be huge for obesity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so if it's separate from leptin, does that mean they could combine treatments? Like, that could be huge for obesity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Potentially, yeah! Professor Ohlsson mentioned that. But here's the kicker, and this is where the sitting comes in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Potentially, yeah! Professor Ohlsson mentioned that. But here's the kicker, and this is where the sitting comes in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: it is possible that leptin combined with activation of the internal body scales can become an effective treatment for obesity, said Professor Claes Ohlsson at Gothenburg University.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-oh.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-oh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He says that when you sit down, these internal body scales give an *inaccurately low measure*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He says that when you sit down, these internal body scales give an inaccurately low measure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We believe that the internal body scales give an inaccurately low measure when you sit down. As a result you eat more and gain weight, says Ohlsson.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, I see where this is going.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I see where this is going.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right! So, as a result, you eat more and gain weight because your body thinks it weighs less than it actually does. It's like it's screwing with your body's natural system.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right! So, as a result, you eat more and gain weight because your body thinks it weighs less than it actually does. It's like it's screwing with your body's natural system.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result you eat more and gain weight, says Ohlsson. In other words, sitting could really be killing us because it distorts the body's own picture of how much it weighs, screwing with the systems that regulate body fat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, um, all those standing desk evangelists? They were kind of right all along, huh? My body thinks I'm a lightweight when I'm slumped in my chair.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, um, all those standing desk evangelists? They were kind of right all along, huh? My body thinks I'm a lightweight when I'm slumped in my chair.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! Looks like we all might want to, uh, reconsider those standing desks. Or at least get up more often.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! Looks like we all might want to, uh, reconsider those standing desks. Or at least get up more often.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, there you have it, folks. Get off your tush and on your feet. Your internal bathroom scales will thank you!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, there you have it, folks. Get off your tush and on your feet. Your internal bathroom scales will thank you!
